intro: Chenopodiastrum gracilispicum, commonly known as slenderleaf goosefoot, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is characterized by its slender, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Chenopodiastrum gracilispicum is often found growing in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy environments.
